required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Ipilimumab 3 mg/kg Versus Ipilimumab 10 mg/kg in Subjects With Metastatic Castration Resistant Prostate Cancer Who Are Chemotherapy Naive
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-Blind Study of Ipilimumab Administered at 3 mg/kg vs 10 mg/kg in Adult Subjects With Metastatic Chemotherapy-Naïve Castration Resistant Prostate Cancer Who Are Asymptomatic or Minimally Symptomatic

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the safety and effectiveness (how well the drug works) of two different doses (3 mg/kg and 10 mg/kg) of Ipilimumab (Yervoy™) in patients with metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
Prostate Cancer Clinical Trials Working Group 2 (PCWG2)
Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until disease progression or death (assessed up to December 2016, approximately 24 months)
primary_outcome.description: rPFS was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of disease progression based on radiographic evidence and/or death from any cause, whichever occurs first. Radiographic disease progression is defined as: Confirmed bone disease progression according to criteria adapted from the Prostate Cancer Clinical Trials Working Group 2 (PCWG2), OR Non-bone disease progression according to the modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The number of participants with reported radiographic progression is shown.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced Immune-related Adverse Events (irAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of ipilimumab to last dose plus 90 days
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of participants with immune-related adverse events of any grade is reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to death from any cause (assessed up to December 2016, approximately 24 months)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of death. For those participants who have not died, OS was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The total number of reported deaths is shown.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prostate Specific Antigen Progression-free Survival (PSA PFS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to the earliest date of PSA progression or death, whichever comes earlier (assessed up to December 2016, approximately 24 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Prostate specific antigen progression-free survival (PSA PFS) was defined as the time from randomization to the earliest date of PSA progression or death, whichever occurs earlier. Participants who did not progress or die were censored at the last PSA assessment date. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The number of participants with reported PSA progression is shown.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until pain progression (assessed up to December 2016, approximately 24 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain progression was defined as an increase in BPI-SF pain Item #3 score of >= 2 point from baseline maintained over 2 consecutive periods. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment, and presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The number of participants with reported pain progression is shown.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to PSA response (assessed up to December 2016, approximately 48 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PSA response rate was defined as the proportion of participants with a 50% or greater decrease from baseline to the lowest post-baseline PSA result (confirmed 3 weeks later) for each randomized arm. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The number of participants showing PSA response is shown.

arm_group.description: Ipilimumab 3 mg/kg injection intravenously every 3 weeks for 4 doses in Induction phase. Subjects that are eligible to receive Ipilimumab in the Maintenance phase will be dosed every 12 weeks for a maximum of 3 years since the first induction dose

Ipilimumab 10 mg/kg injection intravenously every 3 weeks for 4 doses in Induction phase. Subjects that are eligible to receive Ipilimumab in the Maintenance phase will be dosed every 12 weeks for a maximum of 3 years since the first induction dose

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prostate cancer with metastases
- Prostate cancer should be castration resistant
- Progression during hormonal therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Visceral metastases (eg liver, lung or brain metastases)
- Prior treatment with any immunotherapy for prostate cancer
- Prior or ongoing cytotoxic therapy for prostate cancer
- Autoimmune disease
- Inadequate hematologic, renal, or hepatic function

facility.name: University of Pittsburgh Cancer Institute Cancer Services
Klinikum rechts der Isar der TU
Urologische Gemeinschaftspraxis Dres Stammel U. Garcia

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 82 participants were enrolled; 53 were randomized; 51 were treated with study drug. 29 were not randomized due to screening failures. 2 were randomized and not treated due to administrative reason by sponsor and "other" reason

group.title: Ipilimumab 3 mg/kg
group.description: Ipilimumab at 3 mg/kg was administered by intravenous (IV) infusion over a time period of 60-100 minutes, based on body weight. Induction Phase dosing consisted of a single dose every 3 weeks (Q3W) for 4 doses. This was followed by Maintenance Phase dosing of a single dose every 12 weeks (Q12W). Treatment was for a maximum treatment period of 3 years from the first induction dose of blinded study therapy, or until subject met treatment stopping criteria.

group.title: Ipilimumab 10 mg/kg
group.description: Ipilimumab at 10 mg/kg was administered by intravenous (IV) infusion over a time period of 60-100 minutes, based on body weight. Induction Phase dosing consisted of a single dose every 3 weeks (Q3W) for 4 doses. This was followed by Maintenance Phase dosing of a single dose every 12 weeks (Q12W). Treatment was for a maximum treatment period of 3 years from the first induction dose of blinded study therapy, or until subject met treatment stopping criteria.

outcome.description: rPFS was defined as the time from the date of randomization until the date of disease progression based on radiographic evidence and/or death from any cause, whichever occurs first. Radiographic disease progression is defined as: Confirmed bone disease progression according to criteria adapted from the Prostate Cancer Clinical Trials Working Group 2 (PCWG2), OR Non-bone disease progression according to the modified Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1. After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data. The number of participants with reported radiographic progression is shown.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: After termination of the study, collection of tumor assessments and other data to support the efficacy analyses was no longer required in patients who discontinued study treatment. As a result, the presented efficacy results are based on limited data
